content.question: An exponential relationship exists between the explanatory variable and the response variable in a set of data. The common logarithm of each value of the response variable is taken, and the least-squares regression line has an equation of <math alttext="log of y hat, equals, 7.3 minus 1.5 times x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>log</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mover><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>^</mo></mrow></mover><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo></mrow><mn>7.3</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>1.5</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following is closest to the predicted value of the response variable for <math alttext="x equals 4.8" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4.8</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Calculate summary statistics, relative positions of points within a distribution, correlation, and predicted response.
